Main pronunciation 主要发音: méng

Other pronunciations 其它发音: méng,měng,mēng

Original meaning 本义: Meaning blind, ignorant, stupid.

English senses 英语理解: cover; ignorant; suffer; mongolia

Usage example 用法举例: 蒙冤 méng yuān (be wronged) 蒙混 méng hùn （deceive or mislead people)

Seal characters (1)

矇字的基本解释

矇
mēng
同“蒙1”。

矇字的汉语字典释义

[①]［méng］
［《廣韻》莫紅切，平東，明。］
“蒙4”的繁体字。
(1)盲；目失明。
(2)指乐官。古代以盲人充任，故名。
(3)昏暗。
(4)蒙昩无知。
(5)眯缝。

矇字的康熙字典解释

【午集中】【目字部】　矇； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页819第29
【廣韻】【正韻】莫紅切【集韻】【韻會】謨蓬切，?音蒙。【說文】童矇也。一曰不明也。【釋名】有眸子而失明，蒙蒙無所別也。【博雅】盲也。【詩·大雅】矇瞍奏公。【傳】有眸子而無見曰矇。【疏】矇卽今靑盲。【禮·仲尼燕居】昭然若發矇矣。　又【王充·論衡】人未學問曰矇。　又【徐幹·中論】見人而不自見者，謂之矇。　又【集韻】母總切，音蠓。瞈矇，目不明也。　又叶莫江切，音尨。【東方朔·七諫】終不變而死節兮，惜年齒之未央。將舫舟而下流兮，冀幸君之發矇。　通作蒙。別作?。

Mongolian
Basic explanation of words
Mongolian
mēng
Same as "Meng 1".
Mongolian
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［méng］
["Guangyun" Mo Hongqie, Pingdong, Ming. ]
Traditional characters of "蒙4".
(1) Blind; blindness.
(2) Refers to music officials. In ancient times, blind people were used as the posts, hence the name.
(3) Dim.
(4) Mongolian ignorance.
(5) Squint.
Mongolian

[Afternoon Concentration] [Title Department] 　 Meng; Kangxi strokes: 19; Page number: Page 819 29
[Guang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Mo Hongqie [Ji Yun] [Yunhui] Mo Pengqie,? Yin Meng. [Said the text] Tong Meng also. One said it was unclear. 【Release name】Blind with eyes, there is nothing else. [Bo Ya] Blind. 【Poetry·Daya】The Mongolian roe played the public. [Biography] There are eyes but no vision, it is Meng. 【Sparse】Mengyi is now blind. 【Lie·Zhongni Yanju】It's so clear that it's unclear.　[Wang Chong·Lunheng] People who have not learned are called Mongolian.　[Xu Gan·Zhong Lun] Those who see people but do not see themselves are called Meng.　[Jiyun] The mother always cuts, the sound is a midge. It's blind and unclear.　 Ye Mo Jiangqi again, Yin Shao. 【Dongfangshuo·Seven Admonitions】It will never change but will be dead, but the new year will be young. The boat will flow down, and Ji Xingjun will be fascinated.　Through the blindness. Don't do it?
